questions.question: He has visited ........................... continent on earth.
questions.description: Use every with a singular noun.

questions.question: ........................... the guests have arrived.
questions.description: Use all with a plural noun.

questions.question: We need ................................ people to help us.
questions.description: A few indicates a small number. Any is not possible here but some can be used.

questions.question: ................................... of my friends are atheists.
questions.description: All of these are possible here with different meanings.

questions.question: ................................. child can solve this puzzle. It is so simple.
questions.description: Use a plural noun after some.

questions.question: I didn't get .............................. answer correct.
questions.description: A plural noun should be used after some and few.

questions.question: We have ............................... milk left.
questions.description: Either little or some is possible here with slightly different meanings.

questions.question: ................................ effort is required to learn a foreign language.
.............................. people can speak a foreign language perfectly.
questions.description: Use few with a plural noun. Much and less are used with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: There were very .................................. people at the wedding.
questions.description: Very few indicates a very small number.
